comments.body:
Ima be a bit too verbose just for the sake of communication.
I was about to make a comment on `waitForPodsGone` and `waitForPodsInactive`.
The mechanics for these 2 functions is different than for `WaitForControlledPodsRunning` and `WaitForControlledPods`.
As such, I was going to propose we move these to the e2epod package (https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/test/e2e/framework/pod/wait.go).
We could do that, I think, since without `WaitForControlledPodsRunning` and `WaitForControlledPods`, e2epod wouldn;t be importing e2eresource and then e2eresource could import e2epod (more general package calling a specific-task package makes some sense).

Althogh, since `waitForPodsGone` and `waitForPodsInactive` are both private and apparently only used by `DeleteResourceAndWaitForGC` then there is no point in adding the extra complication :smile:

@alejandrox1 I think you are right. I prefer to keep the visibility of these methods since they are only used in `DeleteResourceAndWaitForGC` now. And if they become more popular someday, someone could make them public and moved to e2epod .
